intro: Acmella mutisii, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often grouped into clusters, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. Acmella mutisii is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. It is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance.
